alert.note: Alert for Northern Oglala Lakota; Pennington Co Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 3:56PM MST until December 26 at 11:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches possible, highest amounts generally in the Wall area and far eastern Pennington County. Snowfall amounts up to 1 or 2 inches are possible from Box Elder to New Underwood. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...The Pennington County Plains and Northern Oglala Lakota County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Pine Ridge Reservation. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means falling and blowing snow with strong winds may produce dangerous whiteout conditions. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

area.areaDesc: Northern Oglala Lakota; Pennington Co Plains
